page.title: 05Life at the Top of the Hill
page.content: A house belonging to Mr. White is on the top of Portsdown Hill. This was originally built in 1882 but in 1967 it was rebuilt. It look down on to a beautiful view. In 1900 it was next to the George Inn. Apart from a church and a chalk pit, the landscape was rather bare at that time. Before 1900 there were horse drawn carts and in 1903 trams travelled up the hill along to Waterlooville. This tram service stopped in 1935 because of the increased number of motorized vehicles. In 1967 Portsmouth City Council altered the traffic system, and the house was pulled down and rebuilt.
